channel.title: [639] Skill Required Command

item.title: [639] Skill Required Command
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

I edited the code down to this :

if (command[0].equals("mediumdung")) { player.getSkills().getLevel(Skills.DUNGEONEERING >= 75); player.sendMessage("You need a dungeoneering level of 75 to do Medium Dungeons"); player.teleport(184, 4332, 0); }
It fixed alot of the errors as I was getting 29 earlier.
But now I only have one error and I don’t know what it is -.-

[code]src\org\dementhium\content\Commands.java:185: error: method getLevel in class Sk
ills cannot be applied to given types;
player.getSkills().getLevel(Skills.DUNGEONEERING >= 75);

                                      ^

required: int
found: boolean
reason: actual argument boolean cannot be converted to int by method invocatio
n conversion
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [639] Skill Required Command
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

if (command[0].equals("mediumdung")) { player.getSkills().getLevel(Skills.DUNGEONEERING >= 75)) { player.sendMessage("You need a dungeoneering level of 75 to do Medium Dungeons"); } else { player.teleport(184, 4332, 0); } }

Play around with the brackets, I don’t have a 639 source so try that.

Read full topic

item.title: [639] Skill Required Command
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

I am trying to make it where you need 75 dungeoneering to use this command

if (command[0].equals("mediumdung")) { player.getSkills().getLevel(Skills.DUNGEONEERING) >= 75 { player.sendMessage("You need a dungeoneering level of 75 to do Medium Dungeons"); return false; player.teleport(184, 4332, 0); }
I’ve tried a few other variations in code but none of them are working, I just get errors when I compile.
Ideas?

Read full topic
